Literature Review: Macro-finance models featuring nonlinear dynamics have gained significant attention in recent years, as they aim to capture the complex interactions between financial markets and the economy. These models incorporate various frictions, such as funding liquidity constraints, market liquidity frictions, and bank run frictions, which are essential for understanding systemic risk and endogenous jump risk. This literature review provides an overview of the empirical evidence and challenges associated with these models, as well as an illustrative model featuring financial frictions and nonlinear dynamics. We also discuss the limitations of local linearization approximations and their impact on the accuracy of impulse responses.
